result.execSummary:
The defendant David P. Bronk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge.   25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

No contact with the family of Ethan Eckerson.
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Sign release of info forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment.
Provide agent with list of all medications that the offender is prescribed.
All prescription medications must come from one pharmacy.
Provide DNA sample.
No contact with anyone associated with or actively using illegal drugs.
Complete an AODA Assessment and comply with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David P. Bronk

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing on 06-09-15 - original filed in 14CF91
and Atty Hughes invoice - original filed in 14CF91
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant David P. Bronk in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Defendant David P. Bronk in custody.  David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are: 15CF25 & 14CF91

9:27 am. Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.
Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Corrections made on the record.
Atty Knaapen argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney Hughes argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes statement.

BY THE COURT:
15CF25 
Ct 1: 940.06(1) 
Determinate sentence of 15 years prison
5 years initial, 10 years extended supervision

Conditions
No contact with the family of Ethan Eckerson.
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Complete an AODA Assessment and comply with recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Sign release of info forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment.
Provide agent with list of all medications that the offender is prescribed.
All prescription medications must come from one pharmacy.
Pay costs
Provide DNA sample
Pay DNA surcharge
No contact with anyone associated with or actively using illegal drugs.

482 days jail credit


14CF91
Ct 1: 961.41(1)(a)
Determinate sentence of 15 years prison concurrent with 15CF25
5 years initial, 10 years extended 
Conditions are same as 15CF25
Same jail credit
Pay costs


Ct 3: 961.41(1m)9a)
Sentence withheld, 7 years probation concurrent with other sentences
Conditions are same as extended supervision


Ct 6: 961.42(1)
Determinate sentence of 3 yr 6 mos prison concurrent with Ct 1 and 15CF25
1 yr 6 mos initial, 2 years extended concurrent 
Same credit as 15CF25
Pay costs

Defendant has the right to appeal.

Atty Hughes makes statement in regards to indigency.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders that there is no reimbursement by the Defendant.
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff's department.

Atty Knaapen questions in regards to defendants eligibility for incarceration program.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is not eligible for challenge incarceration program but is eligible for substance abuse program.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn - Original filed in 15CF25
Sentencing hearing at 06-09-2015 09:15 am

Defendant David P. Bronk in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Defendant David P. Bronk in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:33 am. Court calls case.
14CF91 & 15CF25
Atty Knaapen states appearances.
State has filed an Amended Information.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant waives reading of Amended Information.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF25 
Ct 1 Amended: 940.06(1) NO CONTEST

14CF91
Ct 1  961.41(1)(a): NO CONTEST

Ct 3  961.41(1m)(a): NO CONTEST

Ct 6  961.42(1): NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Hughes.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty in 15CF25 Ct1.   Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Court finds the defendant guilty in 14CF91 Ct1, Ct3 & Ct6.   Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CF25: Cts 2, 4, 5, 7, 8 & 9 DRI

Court orders a PSI.

Bond ordered continued.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Plea hearing at 04-23-2015 08:30 am

10:37 a.m. Defendant David P. Bronk in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Defendant David P. Bronk in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs that there is a Reserve Judge, Judge Miller, has been assigned for the Jury Trial dates.  Parties will address the motions today.
States Motion for Joinder is addressed.
Atty Hughes states the State's Motion is not in proper form and requests it to be denied. Atty Hughes states reasons for Motion for Joinder to be denied.
ADA Knaapen makes further statements in support of the Motion for Joinder.
Atty Hughes makes further statements in support of the denying the motion.
Court reviews transcripts of the files.
BY THE COURT: Motion for Joinder is Granted and the two cases may be tried together.
---------
Defense's Motion to Dismiss 14CF91: delay of speedy trial rights:
Atty Hughes makes statements in support of the Motion to Dismiss.
ADA Knaapen makes statements opposing the Motion to Dismiss.
Atty Hughes makes further statements in support of the motion.
ADA Knaapen makes further statements opposing the motion - valid reason for appropriate delay.
Court reviews files dates and time history.
BY THE COURT:  Motion to Dismiss 14CF91 is denied.
_____
Defense's Motion for 3rd Party Evidence:
ADA Knaapen makes statements opposing the motion. Strick liability case type not motive type.
Atty Hughes makes statements in support of the motion. Motive type case.
BY THE COURT: Motion for 3rd Party Evidence be allowed - Granted.
____
Defense's Motion for Prior Convictions - Granted
____
Defense's Motion to Compel Discovery: 
Atty Hughes states maybe some recordings he should be entitled to.
ADA Knaapen will look into it and will provide if available.
___
Atty Hughes to inform the Court before 4:30 p.m. 04-22-15 if need to cancel and/or reschedule jury trial.
11:40 a.m.Court in recess.

- Defendant's Motion to Admit Third-Party Evidence.
- Defendant's Motion Regarding Prior Convictions.
- Motion to Compel Discovery.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus

Defendant David P. Bronk in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Defendant David P. Bronk in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.

Atty Knaapen makes a statement regarding filing a Motion for Joinder on additional cases.

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Arraignment on March 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

3:15 pm.
Defendant David P. Bronk in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Defendant David P. Bronk in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  (Court appoints Atty Huges on this case as well) .
ADA Knaapen calls witness, Brian Noel, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.  Witness identifies the Defendant in the Courtroom.
3:22 p.m. Cross exam by Atty Hughes. 
3:32 p.m. ADA Knaapen makes final statements.
3:33 p.m. Atty Hughes makes final statements.
3:35 p.m.   Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files an Information.
Atty Hughes request a different date for hearing.
Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not give his medications to any other person. 
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming, if release
No contact with Ethan Eckerson's family or Michelle Wrzinski.

Attorney Michael Hughes in court. Defendant David P. Bronk appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Constable recommends a $100,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Hughes makes arguments re: bond.  Asks the bond in 14CF91 cover this file as well. 
Court questions the defendant's criminal history. 
Atty Hughes responds. 
Atty Constable responds. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
